register.description: This register contains the IP revision code. This code is specified at design time.

bitfield.description: Read returns 0.
IP revision code[7:4]: Major revision[3:0]: Minor revisionExamples: 0x10 for 1.0, 0x21 for 2.1

register.description: This register controls the various parameters of the interconnect.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibilityRead returns 0.
No external memory MRS command

bitenum.description: When set to 0, the SDRC internal and registers (both CS) are written and MR, EMR2 commands are performed to the corresponding registers of the external SDRAM.
When set to 1, only SDRC internal and registers (both CS) are written, no MR or EMR2 commands are performed to SDRAM.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Power management Req/Ack control

bitenum.description: Smart Idle - Acknowledgment to an idle request is based on the internal activity of the module. Issued when the SDRC enters self-refresh.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0
Software reset
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

register.description: This register provides module status, excluding interrupt status info.

bitfield.description: Reserved for module-specific status informationRead returns 0.
Reserved for interconnect socket status informationRead returns 0.
Internal reset monitoring

bitenum.description: Reset completed - The module is ready to be used

register.description: This register configures the start address of CS1 address space. Must be aligned on a boundary that is a multiple of the size of the attached memory, or of the next power of two if the memory size is not a power of two.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
CS1 address space start address (lower add bits a1:a0) / 32MB unit
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
CS1 address space start address (upper add bits a5:a4:a3:a2) / 128MB unit

register.description: This register specifies the SDRC attached memory size and position on the SDRC IOs.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Read-only access lock bit

bitenum.description: When this bit is set, the register can not be unset until next reset of the module.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0s.
Identifies the SDRC pins used by CS1
Identifies the SDRC pins used by CS0
Static 3-state command for the SDRC I/O pads

bitenum.description: All SDRC interface pins are set to hi-Z.
Normal mode: SDRC drives the I/O pads based on the memory traffic.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

register.description: This register captures the address of the last illegal access received on the interconnect.

bitfield.description: Address of illegal access (Bit 31 is always 0.)

register.description: This register provides additional information about the last illegal access.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Identifies the interconnect ConnID of the illegal access initiator: Refer to the top level documentation of the device using the SDRC module.
Write 0 for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
System command of the transaction that caused the error (3-bit field)
Flag that indicates access is to an illegal address

bitenum.description: The system request was to an address outside the memory space.
The system request was to an address outside the register space.
No Err Add. Not an address error
No Err Add. Not an address error

bitfield.description: Transaction error while the memory is in deep-power-down mode

bitenum.description: The memory was not in deep-power-down mode when the error occurred.
The error is due to an unexpected access while the memory was in deep-power-down mode.

bitfield.description: Error validity status - Must be explicitly cleared with a write 0 transaction.

bitenum.description: All error fields no longer valid
Error detected and logged in the other error fields

register.description: This register controls the SDRC DLL A resource used for fine timing tuning on a double-data-rate interface.

bitfield.description: Phase offset value in ModeFixedDelay mode. Maximum frequency supported in this mode is 83 MHz. FIXEDDELAY steps are defined after DLL cell characterization.

Initial latency before first request to be processed in ModeFixedDelay mode 0x0: no initial latency before first access 0x1: 2 clock cycles before first access0x2: 4 clock cycles before first access 0x3: 6 clock cycles before first access 0x4 : 8 clock cycles before first access ...0xFF: 510 clock cycles before first access
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Selects the DLL mode upon hardware idle request

bitenum.description: DLL in Power-down mode upon hardware idle request
DLL in DLL idle mode upon hardware idle request
No action upon hardware idle request. Input clock frequency must not be changed.
Reserved for future use (no action upon hardware idle request).

bitfield.description: Enables the DLL Idle mode
Enables DLL

Selects the DLL functionality between the TrackingDelay mode (previously called lock mode) or the ModeFixedDelay mode (previously called unlock mode). The DLL mode is updated in the DLL cell after:- DLLIDLE mode- DLL power-down mode

bitenum.description: LOCKDLL at 0 puts the DLL in TrackingDelay mode (tracking counter started).
LOCKDLL at 1 puts the DLL in ModeFixedDelay mode. The fixed delay defined in FIXEDDELAY bit field is used to delay DQS lines for read accesses.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Reads return zero.

register.description: This register reflects the current status of the DLL A.

bitfield.description: Reads return zeros.
DLL lock status
Reads return zero.
Reads return zero.

register.description: This SDRC power-management register defines the global power-management policy (shared by CS0/CS1).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
Select if after a SDRC wakeup in DDR mode (in DLL tracking-delay mode), the first request is stalled during 500 cycles latency or until the lock signal from the DLL/CDL analog cell is asserted.

bitenum.description: SDRC allows DDR access after 500 L3 clock cycles.
SDRC allows DDR access as soon as DLL LOCKSTATUS bit is 1.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility.Read returns 0.
16-bit programmable count value used for delayed automatic clock gating and self-refresh entry, assuming CLKCTRL field is not 0
Enter self refresh when a warm reset is applied:
Enter self refresh when on hardware idle request:
Clock control feature defines clock gating and self refresh:

bitenum.description: No auto clk feature turned on
Enable internal clock gating on timeout of Auto_cnt
Enable self-refresh on timeout of Auto_cnt

bitfield.description: Disable the clock provided to the external memories:
Activate the power-down mode of the target memory through CKE pin.
Write 0 for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Page/segment closure policy with respect to power versus bandwidth trade-off - Must be set to 1

register.description: This register provides the memory configuration register.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Read-only access lock bit

bitenum.description: When this bit is set, the register can not be unset until next reset of the module.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
RAS address width

bitenum.description: RAS width = 16 bits - Must not be used
RAS width = 17 bits - Must not be used
RAS width = 18 bits - Must not be used

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
CAS address width
Selects the fixed address-muxing scheme or the flexible address-muxing scheme
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
RAM address space size number of 2-MB chunks
SDRAM banks mapping. Selects the position of the bank address, the row address, and the column address in the system address.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
External SDRAM bus width

bitenum.description: External SDRAM device is x16 bit.
External SDRAM device is x32 bit.

bitfield.description: Indicates if the memory supports deep-power-down mode
DDR memory type (assuming RAMTYPE = 01)
Memory type

register.description: This 12-bit register corresponds to the JEDEC SDRAM MR register, with the standard bit fields. All 12 bits are loaded into memory for future extension support. The SDRC keeps an internal copy register used internally; that is, returned when a read access is performed at that address. Load into memory on interconnect write access using MRS command with BA1,BA0 = 0,0.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Write 0s, as required by memory specifications. Read returns 0.
Write burst support must be zero.

bitenum.description: Write burst disable (single write access only)

bitfield.description: Write 0s, as required by memory specifications. Read returns 0s.
CAS latency as defined by clock periods
Serial or interleaved mode: must be zero
Memory burst length

register.description: This 12-bit register corresponds to the JEDEC SDRAM MR register, with the standard bit fields. All 12 bits are loaded into memory for future extension support. The SDRC keeps an internal copy register used internally; that is, returned when a read access is performed at that address. Load into memory on interconnect write access using MRS command with BA1,BA0 = 0,0.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

bitenum.description: Write burst disable (single write access only)

bitfield.description: Write 0s, as required by memory specifications. Read returns 0s.
CAS latency as defined by clock periods
Serial or interleaved mode: must be zero
Memory burst length

register.description: This 12-bit register corresponds to the low-power EMR register, as defined in the mobile DDR JEDEC Standard. All 12 bits are loaded into the memory, thus assuring future extension support. The SDRC keeps an internal copy register used internally; that is, returned when a read access is performed at that address. Load into memory on interconnect write access using MRS command with BA1,BA0 = 1,0.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Write 0s, as required by memory specifications. Read returns 0
Driver strength0v5: Reserved . 0v7: Optional one-eighth strength driver .
Temperature-compensated self-refresh
Partial array self-refresh

register.description: This 12-bit register corresponds to the low-power EMR register, as defined in the mobile DDR JEDEC Standard. All 12 bits are loaded into the memory, thus assuring future extension support. The SDRC keeps an internal copy register used internally; that is, returned when a read access is performed at that address. Load into memory on interconnect write access using MRS command with BA1,BA0 = 1,0.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibilityReads return zeros.

register.description: SDRAM memory autorefresh control

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Autorefresh counter value to set the refresh period. The autorefresh counter is uploaded with the result of:(tREFI / tCK) - 50
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Autorefresh enable

bitenum.description: Counter is loaded with ARCV: 1 autorefresh command when autorefresh counter reaches 0.
Counter is loaded with 4 * ARCV: Burst of 4 autorefresh commands when autorefresh counter reaches 0.
Counter is loaded with 8 * ARCV: Burst of 8 autorefresh commands when autorefresh counter reaches 0.

register.description: SDRAM memory autorefresh control

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Autorefresh counter value to set the refresh period. The autorefresh counter is uploaded with the result of:(tREFI / tCK) - 50
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Autorefresh enable

bitenum.description: Counter is loaded with ARCV: 1 autorefresh command when autorefresh counter reaches 0.
Counter is loaded with 4 * ARCV: Burst of 4 autorefresh commands when autorefresh counter reaches 0.
Counter is loaded with 8 * ARCV: Burst of 8 autorefresh commands when autorefresh counter reaches 0.

register.description: This register allows to send specific commands to the external memory devices under software control. Any write to this register generates the appropriate sequence based on the command code.

bitfield.description: Manual command parameter, if any.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.
Memory command opcode; other values reserved for future implementations.

bitenum.description: Set CKE signal high - no parameter

register.description: This register allows to send specific commands to the external memory devices under software control. Any write to this register generates the appropriate sequence based on the command code.

bitfield.description: Manual command parameter, if any.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0s.

bitenum.description: Set CKE signal high - no parameter
